page.title: 17BROXBOURNEBURY SCHOOL
page.content: Purchased in l946 by Herts. County Council, Broxbournebury is a Special School for children,aged 3-l2, with moderate learning difficulties. Local children from a wide catchment area arrive daily by bus. Children living further away in the County board from Monday to Friday. At present of the 78 pupils 35 are boarders. Classes are small often below 13 per class & a team of over 30 ancillary workers, child care staff, welfare staff, speech therapists, etc. back up the work of the 10 teachers. 15 of the staff are resident. Besides the usual academic lessons the children enjoy computer studies, cooking, craft work, horse riding & sports especially swim- ming in the school pool! Boarders enjoy after school activities - canoe- ing, trampolining, cycling, camping, Scouting, Guiding & Life Brigade.
